title: PTOS-open-data
text:
Welcome
This is a workshop on open data.
If you like the workshop and want to keep it forever, make it yours. For that…

Fork the github repo this Quarto book is based on
Go to settings of your new repo and go to the “pages” section. Then set the “Branch” option to gh-pages (leave the dropdown to the right of this at /root)
Back on the main repo site, click on “About” (top right). In the URL of the website, change “j-5chneider” to your username “[your github username].github.io/PTOS-open-data/” (you might need to activate GitHub Pages for that, by creating a GitHub Pages repo)
open your new webpage by clicking on the link in the “About” section

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2






Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

1 + 1
